title: Cecilia Joytwin
author: Cecilia Joytwin
content: Think this will help too.1. Less selfies,more soul.2. Because it takes work to be happy, it is uncommon.3. Loneliness can occasionally be a gift as well.4. You don't need to demonstrate your happiness on social media if you are content in real life.5. Both hope and fear spread like viruses.6. Quit assuming that you can't do things.7. For me, I think you want to eat good food, drink clean water, breathe good air, get lots of sleep, get lots of exercise, and do activities that keep you mentally sharp.Â  Also avoiding anything in excess that can lead to negative consequences.Â  This is why it's good to live somewhere with a lots of trees for good air, consider drinking clean water as opposed to soda, get lots of sleep, have a hobby that keeps you moving and thinking, and be somewhat conscious about what you eat.

comments.body: Quote from: Cecilia Joytwin on January 08, 2023, 07:56:48 AMThink this will help too.1. Less selfies,more soul.2. Because it takes work to be happy, it is uncommon.3. Quit assuming that you can't do things.7. There are times when ending a relationship is a positive step rather than a negative one.8. Spend some time alone. You'll learn a great deal.9. Thinking too much makes you unhappyHappy Sunday everyone.It's funny that you bring up the topic of letting go, because many of these sayings appear to emphasize the significance of present. For example, the concept of spending time alone or refraining from reflecting on the past or future. It's almost as if they're suggesting that happiness can only be discovered in the present moment, not somewhere else. I also like the idea of being aware of your own ideas, steps, and behaviours rather than just operating on schedule, so I believe it is not good to dwell in the past or future because being too consumed with what's back or in ahead of us has an emotional impact on us and prevents us from focusing on what is truly important.
